拋.definition: to throw; to toss; to fling; to cast; to abandon

拋下.definition: to throw down; to dump; to abandon; thrown down

拋售.definition: to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)

拋夫棄子.definition: to abandon one's husband and child(ren)

拋妻棄子.definition: to abandon one's wife and child(ren)

拋媚眼.definition: to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)

拋家棄子.definition: (of a parent) to abandon one's family

拋棄.definition: to abandon; to discard; to renounce; to dump (sb)

拋灑.definition: to drip; to flow out; to sprinkle

拋生藕.definition: (Cantonese) (of a woman) to direct a coquettish look, comment or gesture at a guy

拋磚.definition: to get the ball rolling (abbr. for 拋磚引玉|抛砖引玉[pao1 zhuan1 yin3 yu4])

拋磚引玉.definition: lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom); fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling

拋繡球.definition: throwing the embroidered ball (traditional Zhuang flirting game at festivals); (fig.) to make overtures; to court

拋荒.definition: to lie idle (of arable land); fig. rusty because of lack of practice

拋補.definition: cover (i.e. insurance against loss in financial deals)

拋錨.definition: to drop anchor; (fig.) (of a car etc) to break down

拋開.definition: to throw out; to get rid of

拋離.definition: to desert; to leave; to forsake

拋頭露面.definition: to put oneself out in the public eye (said of sb for whom doing so is deemed unseemly)
